indications:
Indications in combination with other drugs, tuberculosis resistant to first-line
drugs
name: CAPREOMYCIN
cautions:
Cautions auditory impairment; monitor renal, hepatic, auditory, and vestibular function
and electrolytes; interactions: Appendix
1 (capreomycin)
side-effects:
Side-effects hypersensitivity reactions including urticaria
and rashes; leucocytosis or leucopenia, rarely thrombocytopenia; changes
in liver function tests; nephrotoxicity, electrolyte disturbances;
hearing loss with tinnitus and vertigo; neuromuscular block after
large doses, pain and induration at injection site
doses:
By deep intramuscular injection, 1 g daily
(not more than 20 mg/kg) for 2–4 months, then 1 g 2–3 times each week
pregnancy:
Pregnancy manufacturer advises use only if potential benefit
outweighs risk—teratogenic in animal studies
